titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the American Board of Commissioners of Foreign Missions annual meeting book 1977.083
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was originally processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-09-21 13:21:57 +0000.

did.unittitle: American Board of Commissioners of Foreign Missions annual meeting book

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: American Board of Commissioners for Foreign Missions

physdesc.extent: in one folder and one oversize folder.

did.abstract: Volume from the 61st annual meeting of the American Board of Commissioners of Foreign Missions in Brooklyn, N.Y., containing a list of corporate members and meeting attendees, as well as information on attendees' states of residence and who they stayed with while in Brooklyn.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of H.H. McFarland, 1872. Formally accessioned in 1977.

bioghist.head: Historical note
bioghist.p: The American Board of Commissioners of Foreign Missions was founded in 1810 to support foreign missionary efforts. The 61st annual meeting of the Board was held in Brooklyn, N.Y. in October of 1870.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); American Board of Commissioners of Foreign Missions annual meeting book, 1977.083, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Volume from the 61st annual meeting of the American Board of Commissioners of Foreign Missions in Brooklyn, N.Y., containing a list of corporate members and meeting attendees, as well as information on attendees' states of residence and who they stayed with while in Brooklyn.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This item is in the public domain.

While many items at the Center for Brooklyn History are unrestricted, we do not own reproduction rights to all materials. Be aware of the several kinds of rights that might apply: copyright, licensing and trademarks. The researcher assumes all responsibility for copyright questions.
